properties.Name: Student Health and Counseling Center
properties.Address: University Center Building, 1880 SW 6th Avenue, Suite 200
properties.Description: The Center for Student Health and Counseling (SHAC) is a community-based health care organization that provides high quality, accessible mental health, physical health, dental, and testing services targeted to the needs of the PSU student population. SHAC supports the University mission and collaborates with University staff and faculty to support student success. SHAC adheres to the PSU policy of non-discrimination.

properties.Name: Quiet Prayer and Meditation Room
properties.Description: The space is open the following hours 7am-8pm Monday through Friday. The purpose of the space includes prayer/Salat, meditation, quiet space, and reflection. In the space students have access to meditation timers, meditation cushions (zafu/zabuton sets), prayer mats, and electric candles.

properties.Name: PSU Food Pantry
properties.Description: Open Monday-Friday, 12:30-2:30 PM. Maximum of 5 free items, excluding freebies and perishables (produce and bread). Bring PSU Student ID. Open to students taking 1 or more credits. Bring your own reusable shopping bag. (bags may be available at the pantry) Can visit the pantry every day of the week.

properties.Name: Harvest Share
properties.Address: Outside Shattuck Hall on the Park Blocks
properties.Description: Second Monday of the month at noon, rain or shine, first-come/first-served. Open to all PSU students, faculty, staff, and community members. Bring your own reusable shopping bag. Dress appropriately for the weather.

properties.Name: Mind Spa
properties.Address: University Center Building, 527 SW Hall Street, Suite 310
properties.Description: The Mind Spa is a space on campus for students to relax and rejuvenate at no charge. Engage in light therapy, meditation, yoga, biofeedback, or a massage.
